oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PHYSICAL MODELLING OF THE WOLF ROCK LIGHTHOUSE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Raby, Alison Caroline
Dassanayake, Darshana
Antonini, Alessandro
Ransley, Edward
Monk, Kieran
Greaves, Deborah
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The EPSRC-funded STORMLAMP brought together a range of engineering disciplines to investigate the structural response of rock lighthouses under wave loading. Here we present hydrodynamic scale modelling of the Wolf Rock lighthouse. This lighthouse is the most exposed of Trinity House’s towers. It is perched on the top of a wave-washed reef, surrounded by water depths of ~ 50 m, and subjected to Atlantic waves. Preliminary STORMLAMP experiments had approximated lighthouse geometries to cylinders on the top of a plane slope in a 2D flume or on top of a conical frustum. All experiments were conducted in the University of Plymouth’s COAST Laboratory.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.32
